meanings.sent1: The lemonade was acetose, making my mouth pucker.
meanings.sent2: The vinegar had an acetose flavor that made my salad tangy.
meanings.sent3: She joked that the acetose candy was so sour it could make a lemon wince.
meanings.sent4: The acetose smell of the pickles filled the room like a sharp, tangy cloud.
meanings.sent5: The acetose taste of the green apple was like biting into a sour explosion.

meanings.definition: Having a sour or acid taste
meanings.sent1: The yogurt had an acetose tang that tickled my taste buds.
meanings.sent2: The acetose grapes left a sharp aftertaste in my mouth.
meanings.sent3: He found the acetose lemon so sour, he puckered his lips in surprise.
meanings.sent4: The acetose flavor of the orange juice was like a burst of citrusy tanginess.
meanings.sent5: The acetose strawberries made her mouth water with their sour sweetness.

meanings.sent1: The acetose soup had a sharp, tangy flavor that woke up my taste buds.
meanings.sent2: The acetose candy left a sour taste in my mouth.
meanings.sent3: She made a face after tasting the acetose vinegar, surprised by its sharpness.
meanings.sent4: The acetose sauce on the ribs was like a zesty explosion of flavor.
meanings.sent5: The acetose lemonade was so sour, it made my eyes water with each sip.
